WorkItem.Description:
Hi All,
 
 I get the foolowing error while trying to printcalendar.aspx in beta 3.1
 
Server Error in '/' Application.
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------
 
Using themed css files requires a header control on the page. (e.g. <head runat="server" />). 
Description: An unhandled exception occurred during the execution of the current web request. Please review the stack trace for more information about the error and where it originated in the code. 
 
Exception Details: System.InvalidOperationException: Using themed css files requires a header control on the page. (e.g. <head runat="server" />).
 
Source Error: 
 
An unhandled exception was generated during the execution of the current web request. Information regarding the origin and location of the exception can be identified using the exception stack trace below.  
 
Stack Trace: 
 
 
[InvalidOperationException: Using themed css files requires a header control on the page. (e.g. <head runat="server" />).]
   System.Web.UI.PageTheme.SetStyleSheet() +1995718
   System.Web.UI.Page.OnInit(EventArgs e) +2057552
   System.Web.UI.Control.InitRecursive(Control namingContainer) +321
   System.Web.UI.Page.ProcessRequestMain(Boolean includeStagesBeforeAsyncPoint, Boolean includeStagesAfterAsyncPoint) +692
 
 
Anyone experiencing the same issue?

Comments.Message:
Yea... I know about that.

At the top where it says <@Page.... put in EnableThemes=False

(maybe with quotations)

That should fix it.

I tried your EnableThemes=False fix and it didn't work.  What did I miss?  I tried EnableThemes="False" and "EnableThemes=False"  I could get a good build. What file requires the <head runat="server" /> ?  and where should it be placed?
